name: aluminium around steel bi-metal wire production, 3.67 mm external diameter | aluminium around steel bi-metal wire, 3.67mm external diameter | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12852/documentation

This dataset represents the production of aluminium and steel bi-metal wire, which consists of the co-extrusion of aluminium and steel. The final product is usually a cast aluminium alloy layer around a carbon steel wire. The data providing manufacturing company supplies a range of wire sizes, from 2.05 to 5.19 mm of exrternal diameter. The aluminum layer thickness is at least 10% of the wire radius and approximately 25% of the cross-sectional area. The modelled product is compliant with ASTM B415 and ASTM B502 standards. This dataset represents a 3.67 mm wire since it is the size for which data were provided on a per kg basis but the dataset is parameterized to the wire external diamteter so new instances can be created for other diameters.

From the reception of the material and energy inputs at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the bi-metal wire ready for shipping or to be used in the manufacturing of standed cable.
This dataset includes: pre-treatment process steps for both the steel wire and the aluminium rod (cleaning, rinse and drying) ; heating of the steel wire ;  co-extrusion of aluminium around the steel wire with lubricant ;  water cooling ; air drying ; eddy currents inspection ; drawing of the wire and winding on coils.
This dataset excludes: secondary packaging crate (4.75E-4 kg of sawnwood per kg of 3.67 mm diameter cable).
category: C:Manufacturing/25:Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment/259:Manufacture of other fabricated metal products; metalworking service activit/2599:Manufacture of other fabricated metal products n.e.c.

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most used technology. Alternate technology (aluminium in powder form instead of rod) is estimatred to represent less than 10% of market.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data was obtained from the data providing company on a per kg basis, it was converted to a per m reference flow using a power function derived from wire mass-to-length data for wires of 2.05 to 5.19 mm of diameter data (see Parameters).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Mostly industry data from one manufacturing company in the region of Québec, and some data from literature.

exchanges.description: ACS (Aluminium clad steel) wire.
